items.title: Clash with atpublic
items.body:
This installs into namespace `public` , which has been used by PyPI `atpublic` from https://gitlab.com/warsaw/public .

So the two cant be used together on the same host.

How is this better than `atpublic` ?

items.title: Dependabot couldn't find a requirements.txt for this project
items.body:
Dependabot couldn't find a requirements.txt for this project.

Dependabot requires a requirements.txt to evaluate your project's current Python dependencies. It had expected to find one at the path: `/requirements.txt`.

If this isn't a Python project, or if it is a library, you may wish to disable updates for it from within [Dependabot](https://app.dependabot.com).

You can mention @dependabot in the comments below to contact the Dependabot team.

items.title: Can't find file README.rst
items.body:
pip public install failed.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 28, in <module>
    setup_cfg_data = read_configuration(path)
  File "setup.py", line 23, in read_configuration
    val = open(val).read()
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: './README.rst'

create file README.rst into package please or remove depent into code.

items.title: pip installing 'public' to a new virtual environment shows 0.0.0 version
items.body:
Hi,

Installing 'public' to a new virtualenv installs it with version 0.0.0 which is very strange. We use several 3rd party python components and none of them had such a problem.
(I discovered this issue by installing 'request', then narrowed it down to 'public'. Also, the wrong version of 'public' seems to corrupt the versions of the other components: request, get, post, query-string.)
I need to keep track of the used 3rd party components and their versions so this is a major problem for me.
Please, please fix it!

I used pip versions 8.1.2 (and 9.0.1), 'virtualenv --version' shows 15.0.3.

Sorry I did not find a good way to format the log below, nor to attach as a file, but you can also read it at http://pastebin.com/k9kcvkAe .
Not sure about your environment, so I also tested this in Windows, where this issue also reproduces.
